Back in 2016 this quickly became one of my favorite games of all time, unfortunately the corporate suits at Blizzard/Activision  have decided that they would rather be money hungry breast-milk stealing sexual-harassing goblins. In a few years this game will only be remembered as a massive failure like the company that made it. I really hope they are proud of spending billions to make a game people only like the Porn of now.

I have played Overwatch since the beta. Back when Bastion had a shield in front of him in turret form, if that gives you any context. I loved Overwatch 1 and played it more than I have ever played a PvP game. Probably more than I have played any game.  

Overwatch 2 killed the game I loved, and they really haven't even tried to hide how greedy they are being about it. I could go on and on about how they abandoned OW1 and basically left us with nothing while constantly saying it was all going to be worth it, the effort was being put into 2. I have yet to see that effort (this is not aimed at the hardworking people who put the game together, but the greedy CEO and upper management that clearly only had dollars on their mind, thinking of us as cash cows rather than giving a hoot about the game itself). 

I finally quit when they announced PvE was going to be a sad shell of what they promised, none of what I was looking forward to. That was my last bastion of hope, ripped away without a shield. I could no longer ignore all the glaring issues, removed features, greed, and just all around downgrade that was OW2. 

Don't waste your time until they sing a different tune, which I don't have high hopes of them doing. 

oh I like the ping system, that was a really good addition. There, I said something positive.

Sincerly, [u]me and my bros who loved the first Overwatch[/u]

https://store.steampowered.com/app/440/Team_Fortress_2/

Just to preface this review, I will barely discuss Activision-Blizzard the company, we already know all the horrendous shit they've been up to and they shouldn't be forgiven for what they've done. This will mostly be a review of my experience with the original game and its "sequel".

I remember playing the original Overwatch Beta with my friends in high school, playing mostly support characters (especially mercy). Then when the game was released, it was the only thing I would play for the next 2 years. It was extremely fun and exciting waiting for updates, new character releases, and lore continuation. Heck, I even played the first few seasons of competitive to get golden guns for my 2 favorite junkers. Those were the golden days of the game. Then things went downhill over time, updates and lore events became scarce, too much focus put only on competitive made any balance changes a nightmare for casual players, and the same seasonal events every single year with no changes. So it became dull and repetitive, so I stopped playing all together.

OW2 does very little to differentiate it from the original, which was already a great game, with the only truly major difference being their emphasis on monetization over fun. Like hell, all the skins I wanted from OW1 I could have just used currency that I got from the free loot boxes I got just by playing the game. Now? 20 dollars for the same legendary skin I was able to obtain for free. 

Moving away from that, they had shut down OW1 for what good reason? Like, honestly, you are going to tell me that Activison-Blizzard couldn't keep the old game up for people who wanted to play it? Nah, just shut it down so we can make people play the money-hungry monster of a sequel that we decided to push out.

Lastly, the most contentious part of the game, the whole reason for its existence as Overwatch "2", PVE. The only thing that got my attention was the announcement of PVE, something that could have been great. I love PVE games: Call of duty black ops (1-3) Zombies, MVM mode on TF2, Warframe, Monster Hunter World, Aliens: Fireteam Elite, Vermintide 2, LFD2, the list goes on and on. The announcement of skill trees and character progression was something very enticing to me, and then they go shit on the whole damn thing in a matter of seconds, essentially wiping out any anticipation of mine to even bother with the game. Then, after watching videos of the $15 pve dlc, I am glad not to have ever spent a cent on Overwatch 2 whatsoever, a disappointing mess of just traveling from point A to B and wiping out the most stupid Ai controlled enemies I have ever seen. The only good thing I saw from any of the playthroughs I watched was the cinematics and character voice lines. That's about the only positives in this disappointing mess of a paid DLC that people were waiting for years to get their hands on.

To say that this game is a disappointment is probably the greatest understatement I can ever make. If you liked playing pvp from the original or just want to play an okay hero shooter, go ahead and play this, no one's stopping you. As for me, I'm just gonna go back to playing on the Selbyen map on TF2 and waiting for Payday 3's release, a better use of my time than writing this review now that I think about it.



P.S. I'm sorry Jeff Kaplan for what that dogshit company, Activision Blizzard, did to your game. I'm also sorry to the developers, who have to endure the brunt of the insults and vitriol while the Higher-ups watch on, sitting on a mountain of money without a care in the world.

I'm glad that my favourite 3d Pornostars are finally getting their own Videogame, but its kinda lame tbh. Was expecting some more "naughty" gameplay but its just about shooting people. Very disappointing. Maybe i have to play trough the story first to unlock the NSFW stuff. Will change my review if this is the case.
